website_summaries.verdict: Travelers and on-the-go students alike will enjoy this pack's organizational compartments and stylish design.
pros: Offers a large pocket for 15-inch laptops, two outer pockets for organizing smaller belongings, and a side drink pouch

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for professionals
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack for professionals! This is a great, durable, well-made backpack with a sleek design appropriate for professionals. Compared to more athletic backpacks (North Face, Patagonia, etc.), the material is thicker and will take daily commute wear well - this is my second TImbuk2 bag (first one lasted 8 years). I like the separate compartment for a laptop, two larger compartments for files and such, and two smaller sections.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Travel Backpack There Is
customer_reviews.text: 100% the best Travel Backpack I've ever used. Whether traveling within the United States or across the world to Europe this backpack was the perfect size to take on Domestic and International flights as a personal item and fit all my daypack essentials. Had no problems claiming it as a personal item with smaller lower budget European airlines as well. And the multitude of pockets and organizers, and TSA-friendly laptop sleeve is perfect for the those pursuing organizational perfection. GAME. CHANGER.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Life time guarantee?
customer_reviews.text: This backpack got constant compliments. Unfortunately it lasted only a year before getting a large tear in the bottom making it useless. Wondering now about the lifetime warranty but information is not easily found. Solid backpack while it was in undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Myrwyn

customer_reviews.title: No opinion on durability yet, but this is The One
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of backpacks over the last few years and they all had some disappointing issue (too small, wrinkly, bulky, uncomfortable, poor organization, no water bottle pocket). I thought I'd try one more time to find one that was comfortable, roomy enough for 3 days as a Spirit personal item, and had decent organization. I do wish it only had two compartments (the laptop pocket and a larger, main one) but this looks to be perfect for my purposes and seems decently made. It has a great TSA-compliant laptop pocket, and two extra handles for wrestling it into the overhead bin. I did spritz it with waterproofing spray just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great travel or commuter bag
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 makes some really solid bags. This is a great travel or commuter bag. It is big. Has plenty of spots to organize yourself. I like that it is TSA Friendly (even though sometimes the TSA still makes me remove the laptop completely). The straps are pretty comfortable, but I know that some people have pinching toward the top near the shoulders. Just something to be aware of. I have not had that issue with any Timbuk2 Backpack and I own 4 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: Great quality backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great quality backpack. I really like all the compartments on this. I love the glasses/sunglasses compartment on the top.. very good feature. The water bottle holder is nice and big. Just a few small cons.. it's pretty narrow, so difficult to get anything too bulky in there. Perfect for travel though. The laptop compartment at the back is underneath the arm straps so that takes a bit of getting used to and can be awkward on a plane when you have a very small space to maneuver. Also the shoulder straps are really close together at the top and I am a small person so they sit right up against my neck and rubs there.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this or any other TIMBUK2 products. The warranty they offer is not as described, you have to pay to ship the bag back to them for evaluation. The stitching on the bottom of my bag broke within 8 months of use. The only reason I bought the bag was for the supposed quality of TIMBUK2 bags and the warranty, but I am not going to pay to ship a bag back to them if the product failed within the first year. Stay far away from this company and its shoddy products.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This Is just the right size for my laptop, a notebook, a folder, all the junk that used to be in my purse, a coffee thermos, a thin cardigan, and enough little pockets for what-if stuff. It is professional enough to carry into office withou looking like I just came from the quad or the trail, and better to my shoulders than the overweight messenger bag I used to carry. Straps and back padding are very comfortable. Straps adjust easily.
customer_reviews.author: K Harper

customer_reviews.title: On the heavy side and a little uncomfortable if u use the computer pocket.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack was purchased to replace a kelty backpack I had used for traveling for 15 years. The build quality is good. There’s many compartments for organizing stuff, but the computer storage area is right against the back and makes the backpack uncomfortable. I stopped using the computer compartment because of this. The backpack is also quite heavy at over 3 pounds empty. The pack is over engineered for what I was looking for in a travel backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Grosvenor

customer_reviews.title: My first one is still in great shape and is functional
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd Timbuk2 Uptown backpack. My first one is still in great shape and is functional, but I got bored with the color and wanted to get a new one. Shipment was quick -- and these Timbuk2 bags are well-constructed and indestructable. Main compartment is very roomy, and has lots of various sized pockets built in for all things big and small. The padding on the straps is very comfortable, and the padding ont he back of the backpack is well cushioned. TSA-friendly. Highly recommend this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Tomamo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design - Not for laptop users
customer_reviews.text: The main draw of this bag is that it stores a laptop but getting to the laptop compartment is very difficult. It's behind the main straps which means you need to have the bag lying down flat and open in order to get to the laptop which means you can't really get your laptop out of the bag until you're already at the head of the line for TSA and even then you have to remove the laptop from the bag entirely because it doesn't fold out. If you like me wanted a work bag to use to store you laptop this bag is absolutely horrid.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse M

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag.
customer_reviews.text: I used this as my only travel bag through Europe for a couple of months. It held my 14” laptop, iPad and clothes. Never had to pay for a carry on or checked bag. I clipped a pair of shoes to the outside with a carabiner. Love all the different compartment for passports and sunglasses and chargers. So nice to have all your things organized in such a compact bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work and travel.
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag as my daily carrier for my work laptop and accessories. There is ample room for all of my daily needs. The fabric is thick and the bag holds it's shape. It has rugged zippers and carries very comfortably. It also has a handle on the side to carry briefcase style. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2 Does Not Honor Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 Does honor lifetime warranty. Had problem with stitching at zipper failing, paid for shipping back to them only for them to inform me that they claimed it was a chemical spilt on zipper. No way that happened, no mark or or other problem with backpack. I am very disappointed and feel like timbuk2 is dishonest and a company that steals form its customers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dent

customer_reviews.title: Great college back pack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for college! Tons of room for books and anything else and the fact that the laptop compartment is completely separate from the main storage area gives me a lot of peace of mind. I can easily fit 2-3 text books, a binder, pens and paper, a light jacket, and my laptop and iPad in it and still have a little room to spare!
customer_reviews.author: Max Weakley

customer_reviews.title: World's best backpack
customer_reviews.text: If you are a student or someone who travels frequently and don't have a Timbuk2 bag, you are living life all wrong. This is the best backpack on the market. It's lightweight, holds your laptop, a jacket and whatever notes you need for the day. Plus, it's perfect for travel. The butterfly bag zips open for TSA ease and fits nicely under the airplane seats. This makes it ideal for an overnight/weekend travel bag. If you are in need of a backpack for any reason whatsoever, stop looking. You found it.
customer_reviews.author: Shappencack

customer_reviews.title: It can stretch to quite significant volumes for a complete day+night out while still being very compact when only lightly loaded (through some miracle of design and sewing that keeps amazing me). It's also very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months now daily. It has the right combination of pockets for me. It can stretch to quite significant volumes for a complete day+night out while still being very compact when only lightly loaded (through some miracle of design and sewing that keeps amazing me). It's also very comfortable. The only negatives are: - You need to put it on it's side and fold up the strap in order to load and unload your laptop. - It won't stand on it's own. This is a bit cumbersome especially when loading and unloading. Still considering its other virtues, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Itai

customer_reviews.title: No enough padding, awkward to access
customer_reviews.text: I still have my first timbuk2 backpack. I have used it for over 20 years. As I've started to carry more expensive electronics and occasionally two laptops, I notice the lack of padding in the bottom of the backpack was a problem. Sadly, this more recently made Uptown is no better. If you use the backpack sleeve, it's OK for protection but the sleeve is extremely awkward to access. Unrelated to this, the chest strap is WAY too high.
customer_reviews.author: robdew

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, but straps are small and laptop compartment isn't the largest
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag to carry back and forth to work and travel with a laptop. While I love the bags layout and organization, the execution of the straps and computer storage are a bit lack luster. I am 6' tall and have broad shoulders, the chest strap was up by my chin. Would recommend it you have a small laptop (read 15" macbook or smaller) and are under 6' tall.
customer_reviews.author: erik nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack purchase in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. Looks great, plenty of zippers and compartments. Incredibly functional. Was getting compliments on it from other Timbuk2 owners during a recent flight. It’s my everyday carry and great when flying for work. I’ll be disappointed the day it needs to be replaced because they are no longer making.
customer_reviews.author: BrianInChicago

customer_reviews.title: good quality product - lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I heard a lot about this brand and thought I would buy it for travel use. It has the modern look that I was going for and I could stuff it with all the items I needed. I wish the eye glass pouch was a bit more sturdy and easy to get to. It blends in so well with the other zippers that I found myself opening the wrong compartment a lot. Other then that its a good back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Hernadez

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, must have despite it's steep price
customer_reviews.text: This bag works beautifully. At first, I was a bit skeptical since even though Timbuk2's website said it was 30 liters, it looked a lot smaller. I am planning on using this for HS and needed a lot of space for textbooks, binders, etc. But after arriving, it worked amazingly. It is the perfect combination of organisation and space. Pros: - A lot of space - Nice tech area - Nice back padding and breathability - Great organisation Cons: - Can't stand up on its own - Straps could be made a bit comfier Overall, I definitely recommend this bag for most purposes. I will update this review if anything happens with he bag.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: Great Daily Carry Backpack
customer_reviews.text: This was my daily carry till I replaced it with a Timbuk2 messenger bag. The organization is first rate and you won’t need to carry an electronics organizer unless you need to. Orientation of the laptop sleeve took a bit to get used to but otherwise a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Doud

customer_reviews.title: SO MANY POCKETS !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this! Very excited as I have had my eye on this for a while. I'm a kind of short girl so the pack feels a bit boxy on me but it's easily adjustable and I love how many pockets it has. I added some key chains to give it some personality as well cuz plain black wasn't cutting it for me. But very excited about the quality
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Watts

customer_reviews.title: Great travel/school bag
customer_reviews.text: Man I use this pack for everything. I've gone on 4 trips where I packed everything in this as my carry-on, I use it daily for work and school. Thing still looks like new and no signs of wear on it whatsoever. Plenty of space for darn near anything and it looks good too!
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: I needed a new bag for work for business trips ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new bag for work for business trips. This has enough pockets and storage for days and the bag is deceivingly small looking. So far i've stored the following things with plenty of room to spare - Macbook - Ipad - Bose Headphone - Macbook Charger - Ipad/ Iphone Charger - Notebooks/Pen
customer_reviews.author: Efren Gort

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for week long trips
customer_reviews.text: Once a month I take a 5-7 day trip for work. This bag is perfect for me. I'm a big guy and I can fit a half dozen XL t-shirts, socks, underwear, a spare pair of pants, some lightweight layers (vest, rain shell), and my 13" laptop, misc cables, toiletries, etc. I sometimes take an iPad or book but that starts to push it a bit. What I love about this bag is that, with all of that stuff, it is still feels comfortable on my shoulders, and fits perfectly under the seat in front of me on the airplane.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Petersen

customer_reviews.title: incredibly durable, comfortable, and utilitarian in design
customer_reviews.text: After all the different high end travel laptop carry on backpacks I have acquired, this is my go to pack for international travel. Mine has been over stuffed, forced under seats, and been my pillow,footrest. The zippers are intact, there are no rips or holes and barely any scuffs. It is amazingly tough, comfortable, and well designed for organization and utility. It is not perfect but its imperfections are easily adapted to because its strengths are so impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Monte Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Airplane Travel
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect travel backpack. I can't even think of enough great words to describe it, it's just perfect. Fits underneath the seat in front on a plane in the general seating, tons of pockets where you need them, expands well when with stuffed with souvenirs... I love it!
customer_reviews.author: bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Tough and stylish
customer_reviews.text: This backpack lasts three times as long as any other backpack I've purchased. It takes a beating. I'm a sucker for many different zipper pockets that give you lots of options for stashing your stuff. It has a good shape that stands up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen de las Heras

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for backpack for international travel.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack was just what the doctor ordered. My wife carried it through the UK and eastern Europe for a week and it worked well. Everything that you needed was easily accessible. I would recommend it for travel. It may seem small to some but it was great on our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Akers

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has this bag for his laptop. He works in IT. So I purchased this brand already being familiar with it. However I need it for travel overseas. It has several compartments, is large enough for my needs but not to big. It is comfortable in the back and I’m positive will travel well.
customer_reviews.author: smrunner

customer_reviews.title: Good 2 day or so trip airline backpack
customer_reviews.text: Works great with plants of space for a two day trip if you pack light. Easily fit under the front passenger seat in front of me on the plane, which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Hitch

customer_reviews.title: ... to replace an aging Q backpack - pack is great, but the quality of the construction leaves a ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried to get this to replace an aging Q backpack - pack is great, but the quality of the construction leaves a little to be desired. Tons of pockets and space for storing stuff, and I really liked the laptop compartment, which is actually raised a little so the bottom doesn't smack the floor every time you put the bag down. Material, while seems flimsy, probably will hold up OK, but only time will tell. Probably gonna go back to my Q backpack until that thing finally dies off.
customer_reviews.author: anthony lam

customer_reviews.title: A perfect backpack. I was in desperate need to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: A perfect backpack. I was in desperate need to replace my Northface backpack after 6 years of considerable use. This backpack is exactly what I needed, perfect for day trips and air travel. Both my laptop and tablet fit in the same easily accessible pouch (TSA friendly). Ample space for a few days worth of clothes and a few books. The material looks to be strong, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Review of a High School Student
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a traveling, this is a great bag with tons of storage to spare. But, my experience with this bag isn’t great. I’m a high school student at 5”4 and this isn’t the right fit for me. It was draining to carry and it felt like a burden to have it because of its size. There are better options if you’re a student. Right now, I purchased the 5.11 Rush 12 and I think it’s great for students so check that out.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Carreon

customer_reviews.title: Great looking high quality backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. Lightweight, lots of pockets and very comfortable to wear. Build quality is excellent and it will definitely last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Pavan Tal

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, but the materials seem lacking at this price point. Good organization pockets, but the laptop compartment is not that large or easily accessable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it as a backpack for high school and has converted the laptop storage to house his flip flops :-( I purchased my husband one because he travels so frequently. His only complaint is the zipper. He would really appreciate a better quality zipper (like Northface). Both are in agreement that it holds a lot of stuff. My son was able to carry all of his school books plus binders on the first day when they were distributed. My husband carries two laptops and an iPad plus accessories for all and other random items.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Needs padding in shoulder straps
customer_reviews.text: The shoulder padding cuts into my shoulders. Not good for carrying anything heavy. Disappointed, especially with the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley C.

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, bad zips, expected more
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 3.5 stars were that possible. The zips are cheap and by that I mean they don't glide smoothly. They dont catch, but when you pull the zip there is noticeable friction. And one small nitpick: why only one bottle side pouch? Could they not have given one on the other side? For this price i expect something a bit better, at the very least, excellent zips. Also the timbuk2 website shows sternum straps, but mine didn't come with any. It is a good bag, and i recommend it but i wouldn't make it my first choice. Check out moutainsmith for tsa friendly bags (if that is what you want).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trips.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Timbuk2 bag. I live and work in NYC, but often make weekend trips to see family in NJ. This bag is perfect for that. I’m able to pack everything I need without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: A.Cal

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous backpack
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this backpack. I travel quite a bit (mainly business) and it is perfect for the items I carry. Easily fits my Macbook Air and iPad in the back zip area and holds all my connectors and wires that I usually travel with. Plenty of room for my typical reading carry-ons and Moleskine notebook. Sturdy handle on the top; I often grab the bag by the top handle, particularly through airline security or getting out of cab. Small, thin handles irritate me. Of particular use are the multitude of pockets inside, especially the two mesh ones in one of the large compartments. Perfect for holding a few connectors and my earbuds, with easy access. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Bentz

customer_reviews.title: Great size quality and function
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this backpack to travel for work trips and it’s the perfect size. I can fit my laptop, a book, a light jacket and pair of shoes along with all my chargers no problem. Really happy with the quality design and look of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Elliot

customer_reviews.title: but figured id give it a try and am very happy and pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for a couple months now and i have to say i'm very impressed with its handling, space, & storage capacity. I was skeptical when i received it, but figured id give it a try and am very happy and pleased. The only small con I have is there were a few thread ends exposed when i received it around the bag by shoulder straps and zippers but I clipped them with nail clippers and bag is good.
customer_reviews.author: Horacio

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic backpack
customer_reviews.text: The compartments are well thought through and it's durable. It would be nice to have some cinch straps but it would look ugly.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mok

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack. Lots of space.
customer_reviews.text: Laptop holder is perfect. Fits multiple sizes. Backpack is sleek with many compartments to store cables and other small objects. Perfect for hiking. Perfect for IT
customer_reviews.author: Tun@

customer_reviews.title: Great for work and travel
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for every day to and from work carry. Even better for business travel. It fits absolutely perfectly under the smallest seat on a southwest flight. Goes through TSA without messing with it = bonus! Love this bag. Well built, good looking. Good amount of pockets without over doing it. And made in USA which influenced my decision greatly when I was exploring options. It would be just fine for a day pack on a hike too, but this thing was built with business travelers in mind. iPad Pro and a 15 inch dell laptop fit just fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved the bag but was disappointed with how quickly holes ...
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 holes on the front pocket 2 months after buying the bag. I loved the bag but was disappointed with how quickly holes developed. I have had a similar bag prior to this one. There were some upgrades made and the change in the material in the ripped pocket was not the same as the first bag. I also need to figure out how to send the defective bag back so I can get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Greenleaf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel notebook/carry on
customer_reviews.text: One of my best travel purchases ever. Excellent storage, durable, safe, and I like the look!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Petree

customer_reviews.title: I do think the zippers could be slightly better and it would be nice if the bottom was ...
customer_reviews.text: I think I will give this a 5.. I don't have a lot of backpacks to compare it too. I do think the zippers could be slightly better and it would be nice if the bottom was more patted but then again it already weighs a bit. I love it though made it through a month of the beach in puerto rico, great on your bike, the laptop back is nice. I can fit quite a bit in this bag. Laptop, ipad, cords, all my colored pencils/highlighter/pens.. i can fit quite a bit of groceries.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly durable despite having pretty heavy things in it. Pretty comfortable to use and the built in bottle opener is a nice touch. My only complaint is I wish it was a little big bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for travel on a plane. Nice size and easy to carry. Worth the extra money it costs compared to others as it is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: jsloyd

customer_reviews.title: Bulky, heavy even empty for every day commuting
customer_reviews.text: Backpack was accurately described, but I found it too big and bulky to commute to work every day. It's heavy, even empty. So that is something to consider. Had to return it and let me just say 5 stars to Amazon, making return so easy.
customer_reviews.author: partyof4

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, you wont go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack. Bought it for my husband for a vacation trip bus tour, and he know uses instead of his briefcase for work he loved it so much. Was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Mae

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this pack accept that it doesn't stand ...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this pack accept that it doesn't stand up. I bent the hard piece in the back and it works better now but a free standing backpack is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, premium finish
customer_reviews.text: Must have for any IT or Businessman, who travels a lot. Great quality, premium finish, good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Spacious bag, zippers are just ok.
customer_reviews.text: Bag looks great and has lots of pockets to store everything from pens to iPads to laptops. Seems to be very durable. Only area for improvement might be zippers - can be a bit tough sometimes. Better quality zippers would make this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The perfect short-trip travel backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have had several timbuk2 bags and this is my favorite. The TSA friendly compartment holds my laptop and this section also easily holds my iPad as well. There is a section for all my power cords, a smaller section for pens etc. And the kicker is there is a compartment for a small amount of clothing. I recently went on a two day business trip and was able to carry just this bag. And given all these compartments, this bag is quite small. I may never get another kind of bag again.
customer_reviews.author: JAFR

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had this backpack for several months and it's held up extremely well. It's spent some time out in the elements, been shoved into tight lockers and overhead compartments, and bumped around subway cars, but it still looks great with no sign of wear. It's extremely well-constructed and nicely designed. I mostly use it for commuting and treks to the gym, but it also serves as a great weekend bag. There are enough zip pockets and pouches for all your stuff and the padded laptop compartment is also perfect for tucking away books or papers you want to keep flat. I'd buy from Timbuk2 again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Alec B

customer_reviews.title: I own three Timbuk2 bags. All purchased for purposes ...
customer_reviews.text: I own three Timbuk2 bags. All purchased for purposes of traveling and bringing my laptop with me. This has plenty of room in the middle compartment. Although there are no extra pockets inside. The laptop compartment has a protective felt and has a IPad holder on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: SaraM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Backpack for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack. Lots of room. Easy to organize your stuff. Very comfortable design.
customer_reviews.author: George Naftzinger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice backpack, especially considering the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice backpack, especially considering the price. A couple of things to make it even better. First, install an inner ring such that keys can be secured in a given place. Also, the carrying straps tend to twist when picking up the pack to place on the shoulders. And finally, adding a carrying handle to carry as a small bag would be a very big plus. But this bag is very functional, and a reasonable value for the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just purchased. Looks/feels great.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is really constructed well, sits comfortably & has storage in all the right places. I did just start using it so I'll need a few trips with it to see what the final verdict is, but I'm confident it'll do fine (or accell) in function as it already does in form.
customer_reviews.author: Broome

customer_reviews.title: Great carry-on
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable with lots of storage options. I took this on a 10 day trip to Europe, and it was a great carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly useful, flat out best pack I have ever purchased. If you travel a lot it is so simple at the airport. It looks modern and is built very well
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I love my backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I love my backpack. It has great pockets! I am so happy I bought this bag after looking at all other options.
customer_reviews.author: UserFriendly

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on two trips with this bag since purchase and love it. It fits well, holds everything I need it to, and packs well on the motorcycle. Has easily became my daily "IT" bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: Well Built; decent price. Thumbs up...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's laptop. Fits a lot and has a good amount of padding compared to some similarly priced packs.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: My 5th bag...this one for my son. Very well made and great looking. Plenty of storage for laptop, iPad, etc. if you are a north face person, ditch those flimsy things and check out a timbuk2. Way nicer...and likely cheaper too
customer_reviews.author: David Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very practical, lots of space for all my stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy backpack with lots and lots of space for laptop plus tablet, cell phone, and everything I need to attached to them. Not to mention a water bottle in one side pocket and snacks in the other.
customer_reviews.author: smallworld

customer_reviews.title: Nice but zipper problems.
customer_reviews.text: Great compact backpack, but the zippers are not smooth and often stick. I may go back to my old work backpack - it may be larger but I like that the zipper doesn't snag. Overall, this is an ok pack. Looks great, but too bad about the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2 will always be my favorite type of pack
customer_reviews.text: Use as my day bag for all my tech and stuff. Cant wait to take it overseas! Timbuk2 will always be my favorite type of pack!
customer_reviews.author: silverklown

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Feels like a solidly built backpack. The TSA friendly back-cushion is great. Have had no problems with it. Straps are comfortable as well. Water bottle holder may be tight for anything wider than a standard klean canteen.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2 Quality / Function
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Looks good and it has plenty of pockets even a sunglass pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Bills Adventures

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE ALL THE POCKET / ORGANIZING SPACE -- IT MAKES ...
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE ALL THE POCKET / ORGANIZING SPACE -- IT MAKES FOR EASY ACCESS FOR TRAVEL. -- ESP LOVE THE LOCATION FOR THE LAPTOP
customer_reviews.author: K. Whitlow

customer_reviews.title: Great caryon pack.
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out pocket placement. Smaller easy access pockets on the front; and a perfectly placed one on the top of the pack that I used to dump change, watch and wallet before entering TSA screening. Rugged and comfortable. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Straps unraveling
customer_reviews.text: One of the bottoms of the shoulder straps has started to unravel only a few months into very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena A Kauppila

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Roomy with lots of pockets!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. Fantastic quality, a lot of room, and a lot of pockets. The side handle is also great if you'd rather tote the bag on your hand. I was trying to decide between a few Timbuk2 bags and this is the one I landed on. It's an awesome backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: A great backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for medical school, and it was been amazing. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: Organization
customer_reviews.text: Good overall backpack, lots of organization compared to others I could find. Feels pretty solid as well.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Mellinger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack
customer_reviews.text: Honestly was skeptical on whether or not I could be happy with a backpack I bought online. This one is extremely comfortable and the pockets are all very useful. Worth every penny I’ve paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Yi

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this type of backpack that allowed me to travel with my laptop, without the need of taking it out. The separate compartment is big enough to fit an 17 inches computer.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Pantaleon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dependable backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I've used this for three months now for school and flown with it. It's easy to open the computer flap to go through security. It has many pockets to stay organized. I can fit my computer, two textbooks, a small binder, and some small items in the front pocket. More than that, it becomes uncomfortable (heavy). I did fly with it and stuff a couple sets of clothes, some school material and puppy treats so its versatile. No problems with zippers or straps yet. The gray is nice, not to masculine or feminine. I dig my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Urban dweller!!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my urban dweller son! He loves it! Aesthetically pleasing. Great storage options. It's a total hit!
customer_reviews.author: Rubeslippr

customer_reviews.title: Helps avoid back pain!
customer_reviews.text: Love all of the little pockets, and I can carry heavy stuff without getting low back pain!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ondatje

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backpack, really can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.text: This can hold so much it's nuts. I use it for skiing, hiking, staying at a buddy's house for a few days, etc etc. It is truly an all purpose backpack. Durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Crain

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, my wife loves how heavy duty it is, and she finds it very attractive as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danny P

customer_reviews.title: Needs a luggage sleeve for roller bags.
customer_reviews.text: needs a luggage sleeve. The backpack is fine otherwise. I like the size and pockets. Fits nicely on the shoulders. Since it is missing a luggage sleeve it does not work well with other carry on roller bags.
customer_reviews.author: Baby monitor father

customer_reviews.title: Agree with others about the materials
customer_reviews.text: I agree with what others are saying about the materials. I wish it was a little thinker. Reminds me of an old Jansport backpack from high school. Other than that I love this bag and would buy again. Update: TSA screening went without a hitch in multiple cities. I've also found this bag makes a great low-profile DSLR (large body) camera bag with the addition of the Cosmos Insert.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle May

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  And...
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Several people have mentioned that a key clip would be helpful. If it had that and a "zippered expander" to make the main compartment about 1" deeper when I need it, it would be the perfect pack for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bag but other countries don't care that the TSA approved the zip open laptop sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice it the top carry handle was padded in some ...
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as big as I thought it would be. Would be nice it the top carry handle was padded in some minor way. Other than that, the build quality seems really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Durable, stylish, slim, and stunning! The backpack although pricy is worth every penny it cost. Very comfortable also
customer_reviews.author: elsnyc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend it if you are looking for a good quality backbag. Nice design, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... now and as a frequent traveler this bag is awesome. I do think that there should be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this guy for a few months now and as a frequent traveler this bag is awesome. I do think that there should be a little of padding in the laptop pocket, although I can see how it can be a bit uncomfortable on your back while wearing it..
customer_reviews.author: carlos suarez

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome bag. I use it for commuting by bicycle
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome bag. I use it for commuting by bicycle, everything I need fits perfectly; shoes, lunch, and clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hill

customer_reviews.title: Easily fits under airplane seat
customer_reviews.text: Light weight with many compartments. Easily fits under airplane seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at how cheap and awesome this bag is.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2, never go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I like the rugged look and the fact that it's not too shabby for work too! The plus point is the TSA laptop and ipad compartment. I can put in many items in the bag with my laptop in a separated compartment and the bag still looked thinner as usual. Excellent buy I must say!
customer_reviews.author: Yeo Song Ren

product_meta.title: Timbuk2 Uptown Laptop Travel-Friendly Backpack
product_meta.description: Just because your commute occasionally takes you cross-country instead of across town doesn't mean you need more than a backpack. The Uptown has designated spots for your laptop, iPad and peripherals as well as your non-gadgety items. Plus, it opens up to lay flat on its way through security.
feature_bullets: THE UPTOWN: The go-to laptop backpack traveler for WFF (Working From Fiji)

KEEP IT ORGANIZED: Front zip pocket for keeping small items in check; Large main compartment for books, jacket, and other carry-on essentials; Stretchy external side pocket for u-lock or water bottle; Tricot-lined floating pocket protects sunglasses or smartphone
CLEVER EXTRAS: Vista loop for attaching blinky bike lights; Laptop pocket compatible with 15" laptop and tablet
MATERIALS & FIT: Channeled airmesh ventilated back panel; Custom-fit strap design for a truer, more comfortable fit; Main body material is rugged 900D Basketweave Poly

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Timbuk2 stands behind the legendary quality and craftsmanship of all our products; We also embrace the wild, twisty ways of life; If there is a defect in the materials or workmanship we will repair the bag at our discretion for the lifetime of the product

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
